newsitem.title: UK: MOTOR RACING-STEWART SIGNS BARRICHELLO TO THREE-YEAR DEAL.
newsitem.headline: MOTOR RACING-STEWART SIGNS BARRICHELLO TO THREE-YEAR DEAL.

text.p: The Stewart Grand Prix team said on Tuesday they had signed Brazilian Rubens Barrichello to a three-year contract.
The 24-year-old Brazilian will team up with Denmark's Jan Magnussen at the Scottish Ford-powered team after four years with Jordan.
"We are delighted to have Rubens with us from the start," said the head of the new team, former world champion Jackie Stewart.
"We said from the outset that we want a driver with Formula One experience alongside a young, up-and-coming talent.
"Rubens brings the experience to complement the raw talent of Jan, but he is still young himself and can continue to develop as he helps us to build the team."
Barrichello added: "The kind of opportunity I have been presented with by Stewart-Ford doesn't come along every day: the chance to build a new Formula One team from the ground up."
Earlier this month, Magnussen, 23, agreed to a four-year contract with the team who will make their debut in the 1997 season opener in Australia next March.
Barrichello's replacement at Jordan has yet to be announced.
